intro: Adicea cuneiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf adicea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Adicea cuneiformis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
